attributes.action: Referendum on the UK's membership, to the European Economic Area (EEA).
attributes.additional_details:
-This is not a second EU Referendum!
-The referendum results were to narrow to allow too much of a radical change to our relationship with Europe.
-Please google the "European Economic Area" 
-Not everybody who voted to leave the EU are against free movement, or membership to the common market.
-Membership in the EEA allows unfettered access to the common market like an EU member.
-An EEA member is under no obligation, to adopt all EU laws or match the financial contribution of EU member states.
attributes.background:
-The decision on the UK's membership in the EU was considered important enough to put to a peoples vote.
-The decision on our future relation with Europe, is equally important, if not more so.
-People who voted to leave all did so for different reasons and are therefore divided on our future.
